meanings.definition: To write or produce a monograph.
meanings.sent1: She monographed her research findings for the academic journal.
meanings.sent2: The professor monographed a detailed analysis of ancient civilizations.
meanings.sent3: The student monographed her favorite recipe for a class project.
meanings.sent4: He monographed his thoughts on the importance of friendship.
meanings.sent5: The author monographed a fascinating story about space exploration.

meanings.sent1: The university press monographed the latest work on environmental sustainability.
meanings.sent2: They monographed a collection of essays on modern art.
meanings.sent3: The publishing house monographed a book on healthy living tips.
meanings.sent4: The company monographed a guide to financial planning.
meanings.sent5: The author eagerly awaited the moment when the publisher would monograph her manuscript.

meanings.definition: A written work on a single subject or an aspect of a subject, usually by a single author.
meanings.sent1: The library acquired a new monograph on marine biology.
meanings.sent2: She enjoyed reading a monograph on the history of architecture.
meanings.sent3: The monograph on climate change was both informative and engaging.
meanings.sent4: The professor assigned a monograph on the impact of technology on society.
meanings.sent5: The author's monograph on ancient civilizations became a bestseller.
